skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Cavaroc’s armoury is perhaps one of the greatest in all the High Realms of Athel Loren; mountains of lightweight but sturdy armour are stockpiled within the Halls of Equos.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +15%  for Wood Elf Cavalry
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.

The Elves of Cavaroc are widely considered as exceptional horsemasters, and the first to march when the war-horns are sounded. Whenever the Asrai reach out of Athel Loren, it is all but a certainty that the Glade Riders of the Skymark Reaches will be found at the head of their mad charge.

effects.description:
Enables passive ability "Frenzy" for Wood Elf cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Naturally, the expert horsemasters of Cavaroc are also precision archers, a deadly combination to any foe.

effects.description:
Armour-Piercing Missile Damage: +3 for Wood Elf Cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +25%  for Wood Elf Cavalry
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Forest spirits are often used by the Elves of Cavaroc to charm and infiltrate neighbouring nations, meaning no scheme or plot is hidden from Edrael.

effects.description:
Agent Action Succes Chance: +15% for Branchwraiths
	(local province)

Contact Effect "Charmed!" for Branchwraiths
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Fashioned by Edrael’s command, these well-crafted weapons are only to be used in dire circumstances, as it would be a waste to dull such fine blades on an unworthy foe.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +2 for "Arrow of Kurnous" and "Prey of Anath Raema"

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.

Edrael has employed subtler means of foiling the schemes of overreaching Bretonnian nobility. The revered Damsels of neighbouring Dukedoms have been supplanted with Forest Spirits, who leak critical information and sabotage precious supplies.

effects.description: Grants Line of Sight over the enemy faction's territory when fighting against Bretonnian Dukedoms (Triggers a turn after declaring war)

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Bretonnia
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Bretonnia
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Starfire arrows glow with unnatural light and emit a piercing wail when they draw blood, chilling the soul of even the bravest warrior.

effects.description:
"Starfire Tips" (projectiles cause armour-piercing and fire damage) for Glade Riders
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
Edrael weaves in and out of combat with incredible skill, dodging most attacks with ease.
When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.
Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assist you, but always make sure you thank her afterwards…
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

Missile strength: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

skillTree.localised_description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units

Melee defence: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +6 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 3% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 6% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Kindred of Equos originally migrated from the coastal colonies of the Elves. After the War of the Beard concluded, they were the only ones to keep and breed horses. They made their home in the meadow glades and heaths of the forest, becoming the guardians of the borderlands.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wood Elf Cavalry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Armour-Piercing: +5 Wood Elf Cavalry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Glade Riders, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit can fire while on the move.

effects.description: Pastures Resource building provides extra bonuses
Upkeep: -25% for Wood Elf Cavalry units

items.colour_text: A fine blade made from the strongest steel. With this weapon, Edrael is dangerous even when his quiver is spent.

Missile resistance: +5% for Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Cavaroc’s Lord receives only the finest arrows, made to snipe enemies with deadly precision.

effects.description: "Starfire Tips" (projectiles cause armour-piercing and fire damage) for Edrael
Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Cavaroc, or the Skymark Reaches, is a land of meadow glades and sparsely wooded grasslands. The Elves of these lands are brash and quick to anger, often getting into skirmishes with greedy Bretonnian dukes.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle
Replenishes 25% campaign movement range after enemy retreats from battle

Fatigue: -66%  for Wood Elf Cavalry
	(Lord's army)
Feigned Retreat: Grants Devestating flanker attribute after retreating.
